project.name: GPIO control
project.description: GPIO control Android app demonstrates Kaa event subsystem capabilities
project.details:
This app demonstrates Kaa event subsystem capabilities on Android platform.

Installation

Download the .apk to your Android device by clicking the "Binary" button on the left. Make sure that the device permits installing apps from "Unknown sources". Open the downloaded apk and follow the on-screen instructions.

Playing around

Make sure that the Kaa sandbox is up and running. You will need to install this application on two devices at least. Start application on one of the devices and choose "GPIO control". Any password will be accepted since trustful user verifier is used for demonstration purposes.

Start application on one of the devices and press on "+" button placed at the right bottom side of the screen. In dialog enter endpoint id and click OK. Then click on any appeared device and try to toggle the switches. Please note that all features of Administrative UI are also supported by REST API.

What's next?

Get the source code by clicking the "Source" button on the left and start hacking!

For more background on Kaa Event subsystem please refer to the corresponding programming guide and design reference sections.
